716641f.text:
82-78 Beaver Street, adjoining and east of the S. E. corner of Hanover Street. At the left is an excavation that extends to Pearl Street, tho the latter is not shown.
July 6, 1903
Wurts Brothers
716641f.folder: Beaver Street & Hanover Street, Manhattan, NY

716638f-a.text:
Beaver Street, north side, east from and across Hanover Street, showing the low Brown Bros. and Co. buildings under demolition. Adjoining same is the 25 story Munson S. S. Line Building, a triangular structure at the apex formed by Beaver Street converging with Wall Street. At the left margin is a portion of the Canadian Bank of Commerce, a building subsequently demolished for the 59 story City Bank Farmers Trust Co.
Building.
Views 2 and 3 are down Exchange Place, a before and after demolition view of the aforementioned Brown Bros. Building. To the right here is the Canadian Bank of Commerce again, on the left being the National City
Bank.
Views: 1,2 March 27, 1928
View 3: June 10, 1928
P. L. Sperr
716638f-a.folder: Beaver Street & Hanover Street, Manhattan, NY

720329f-b.text:
Hanover Street, east side, north from Beaver Street to Exchange Place, showing workmen erecting scaffolding for the demolition of the Brown Bros. & Co. Building, which occupies that block. On the left, appears the National City Bank Building, at the N.W. corner of Exchange
Place.
March 27, 1928.
T. L. Sperr.
A part of the same, showing the Brown Bros. Co. Building in an advanced stage of demolition. This site is now (1937) ocoupied by the
35-story Wall and Hanover Building.
Juae 10, 1928.
P. L. Sperr.
720329f-b.folder: Hanover Street & Beaver Street, Manhattan, NY

720329f-a.text:
Hanover Street, east side, north from Beaver Street to Exchange Place, showing workmen erecting scaffolding for the demolition of the Brown Bros. & Co. Building, which occupies that block. On the left, appears the National City Bank Building, at the N.W. corner of Exchange

720328f-a.text:
Hanover Street, west side, between Exchange Place (richt), and Beaver Street (left), showing the 8-story building of the Canadian Bank of Comerce. It was demolished in 1929, and on its site now stands the 59story City Bank and Farmer's Trust Company Building. The clearance in the foreground, is at the N.E. corner of Beaver Street, and was created by the demolition of the Brown Bros. and Co. Building. On its site now (1937),
stands the 35-story Wall and Hanover Building.
June 30, 1928.
P. L. Sperr.
720328f-a.folder: Hanover Street & Exchange Place, Manhattan, NY

720327f-a.text:
Panover Street, north from Seaver to Wall Streets, showing (right), a portion of the Wall and Hanover Buildings on the N.E. corner. Hanover Street at Exchange Place makes a bend in an easterly direction, thereby hiding from view the east side of the street, and exposing the west side, from Exchange Place to Wall Strcets, showing the National City Bank Suilding, oooupying that block. A foot hridge can be seen connecting the latter building, with the
35-story Wall and nanover Buildings.
June 13, 1929.
P. L. Sperr.

716637f-a.text:
Beaver Street, east from William across Hanover to Pearl Streets, showing the lower portions of the skyscrapers that fill this, the financial district; that on the left is the City Bank, Farmers Trust Company, and on the right, the New York Cotton Exchange.
November 7, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.

720326f-a.text:
Hanover Street, south from all to Beaver Streets, showing the building of Brown Bros. 3 Co. (left foreground). Hanover Street at Exchange Place, makes a bend in an easterly direction, thereby hiding from view, the east side
of the street, and exposing the west side.
March 27, 1928.
P. L. Sperr.

1507567-a.title: Hanover Street #7 - Beaver Street - Pearl Street
1507567-a.folder: Hanover Street #7 - Beaver Street - Pearl Street, Manhattan, NY

723935f-a.text:
Wall.Street, south side, west from and including Hanover Street, showing the Custom House. This structure was originally the Merchants Exchange. About the turn of the century it became the present
National City Bank.
This photo is a duplicate of a print included in this collection.
1886
Gift Thru New York Historical Society
723935f-a.folder: Wall Street & Hanover Street, Manhattan, NY
